'Uridine 5'-diphospho-glucuronosyltransferase' (UDP-glucuronosyltransferase,
UGT) is a glycosyltransferase () that catalyzes the transfer of the glucuronic
acid component of UDP-glucuronic acid to a small hydrophobic molecule. This is a
glucuronidation reaction.

Alternative names: *glucuronyltransferase *UDP-glucuronyl transferase *UDP-GT
